    • helpCommands

      public String helpCommands​(String cmd, String message)
      list of possible action during the turn
      Parameters:
      cmd - a string potentialy containing a command to parse
      message - a message to show after the execution of a command
      Returns:
      a string containing the input the user asked before helpCommand was called
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if a thread is interrupted while helpCommand this function "crush"

    • customRead

      Returns:
      wanted input

    • isInputCancelled

      public boolean isInputCancelled​(String str)
      return true if this string contain a "cancell" code (this code is caused when interruptableInput is interrupted)
      Parameters:
      str - string to check
      Returns:
      true if this string contain a "cancell" code

    • isInputCancelled

      public boolean isInputCancelled​(int num)
      same of isInputCancelled(string) but with integer code
      Parameters:
      num - integer to check for exit codee
      Returns:
      true if input aborted

    • interruptableCustomRead

      public String interruptableCustomRead​(String message) throws InterruptedException
      equal to custom read but interruptable
      Parameters:
      message - message toshow
      Returns:
      wanted input
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - interrupt exeption (if thread.interrupt is called)

    • askIntExept

      public int askIntExept​(String msg, String error, String errorExept, int min, int max, int except)
      same of ask Int but with an input i dont want
      Parameters:
      except - input i dont want
      msg - message to describe input
      error - error to show if user do something wrong
      min - minimum value acceptable
      max - amximum value acceptable
      Returns:
      an valid integer in range (min,max) typed by user

    • askInt

      public int askInt​(String msg, String error, int min, int max)
      ask for an integer in loop until user insert a valid one
      Parameters:
      msg - message to describe input
      error - error to show if user do something wrong
      min - minimum value acceptable
      max - amximum value acceptable
      Returns:
      an valid integer in range (min,max) typed by user
